ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is a course where you read a lot of papers about South Africa and then go there to see the stuff in person. Though some of the student lectures were a bit dry, I would recommend this course to G&G majors.

Deciding to take this class or not is an easy decision. If you are a G&G major available to go on the field trip, you should take this class. No matter the destination, the field trip will be amazing! I would be hesitant to recommend this class to a student who will not be attending the field trip.

G&G 370 is a must-take for upper level geology majors. The course covers different topics in Earth history/geology through the lens of the destination of the department field trip  in 2011, to South Africa. The tripwill certainly be amazing, but I also really enjoyed the class. Dave gave great overview lectures on different South African geological features that reveal some important event in Earth history (for example, origin of plate tectonics, origin of life, Snowball Earth, Ediacaran explosion, etc). We then read 2-3 articles on which we were quizzed weekly (study because this year your performance determined your $$ contribution), and then the grad students gave presentations. If youre willing to put in the work and want to go someplace amazing with the geology department, take this class!
went through various geological features of South Africa. I would recommend it to anyone interested in Geology. It is a good chance to see many of the students and various aspects of geology.
